sentences.en: Major's elders disliked him because he was such a flagrant nonconformist.
sentences.cn: 梅杰的长辈不喜欢他,因为他这样公开地违反了他们心目中的生活准则.

sentences.en: Oscar Wilde was a noted nonconformist.
sentences.cn: 奥斯卡.王尔德是一位著名的非国教徒.

sentences.en: Their rabidly nonconformist deportment has made them legendary.
sentences.cn: 他们坚决的不信奉国教的行为使他们成为传奇.

sentences.en: Their views are nonconformist and their political opinions are extreme.
sentences.cn: 他们的看法与众不同，政治观点也很极端。

sentences.en: Two college dropouts with mysterious means of income and nonconformist lifestyles.
sentences.cn: 两个大学退学生,有着神秘的收入,过着被世人所不屑的生活.

sentences.en: Victoria stood out as a dazzling nonconformist.
sentences.cn: 维多利亚以令人惊叹的异己形象而引人注目。

sentences.en: Whoso whold be a man, must be a nonconformist.
sentences.cn: 任何名副其实的真正的人, 都必须是不落俗套的人.

sentences.en: Whoso would be a man, must be a nonconformist.
sentences.cn: 任何名副其实的真正的人, 都必须是不随波逐流的人.

words.tran_cn: 不服从的；不信奉国教的；不相容的
不一致；不信奉国教；不墨守成规
不遵照准则；不信奉国教（nonconform的ing形式）

trans.tran_cn: 不信奉英国国教的 n非国教徒
（不信奉英国国教的）新教徒，不墨守成规者，不遵循常规者，不落俗套者
trans.tran_en: someone who does not accept the ways of thinking or behaving accepted by most other people in their society or group
